But if you assume a short shot Group of Death that involves Germany being ousted by South Korea or Spain being knocked out or Brazil being eliminated from the group stage, I think the chances of that have decreased already the way it goes when you expand from 32 to 48 teams, groups get more diluted.

are. Along with this, FIFA set the rules this time in such a way that the first four teams in the international ranking cannot face any of the top two teams until the finals. Also, the third and fourth-ranked teams cannot clash until the semifinals. Furthermore, there will only be one team from each confederation in a group, and if there is a UEFA team, there can be two. So, many permutations and combinations have been avoided here, and in trying to avoid all this, Argentina and Portugal are serving this to themselves. But first, let's take a look at the groups here.
